summary: This document is a chain of FBI emails from August 2019 discussing efforts to locate Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails reveal coordination between FBI field offices to track her location, with the New York office indicating they have a 'silent hit' on her in TECS and are planning to 'grab her' in the future. The correspondence shows the investigation shifting focus to the Crimes Against Children squad.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI emails; the agents are coordinating efforts to locate and eventually apprehend her.

persons.name: SSA Watson
persons.context: An FBI SSA who facilitates an introduction between field offices and advises that the Crimes Against Children squad is a better fit for the Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: A/SSA Slaton
persons.context: An A/SSA from the Crimes Against Children squad who is briefed on the Maxwell case and made available to assist.

persons.name: John Keelan
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge (A/ASAC)
persons.context: An FBI A/ASAC who was updated on information regarding Maxwell's potential presence in Manchester-by-the-Sea.

persons.name: Kathleen Queally
persons.context: An FBI SSA who was updated on information regarding Maxwell's potential presence in Manchester-by-the-Sea.

connections.description: Watson introduces Slaton to another FBI office, indicating they work together within the FBI structure.
Both were updated on the same intelligence regarding Maxwell's location, indicating they are involved in the same investigative chain of command.
SSA Watson is involved in the investigative coordination to locate and apprehend Maxwell.

events.title: FBI seeks to nail down Maxwell's location
events.description: An FBI SSA from New York emails a Boston colleague to determine if Maxwell is still in their area, indicating active location tracking.

events.title: FBI plans 'silent hit' and future apprehension
events.description: The FBI New York office states they have a 'silent hit' on Maxwell in TECS and are looking to 'keep an eye on her location for when we need to grab her,' revealing pre-arrest surveillance planning.

events.title: Intelligence on Maxwell in Manchester-by-the-Sea
events.description: An FBI agent reports receiving information from Manchester-by-the-Sea regarding Maxwell's potential presence there and briefs superiors.

keyFacts: The FBI had a 'silent hit' on Ghislaine Maxwell in the TECS system in August 2019, indicating they were tracking her but not ready for immediate arrest.
FBI agents were actively coordinating between New York and Boston field offices to locate Maxwell, with intelligence placing her potentially in Manchester-by-the-Sea.
The investigation into Maxwell was being transitioned to or coordinated with the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad, highlighting the nature of the case.
The emails reveal the operational planning to 'grab her' was several weeks away from any action as of late August 2019.
Communication shows direct coordination between supervisory agents (SSAs and an A/ASAC) regarding intelligence and investigative strategy.
